settings.title: test difficulty
settings.description: Normal is the classic type test experience. Expert fails the test if you submit (press space) an incorrect word. Master fails if you press a single incorrect key (meaning you have to achieve 100% accuracy).

settings.title: quick restart
settings.description: Press tab or esc to quickly restart the test, or to quickly jump to the test page. Both options disable tab navigation on most parts of the website. Using the "esc" option will move opening the commandline to thetabkey.

settings.title: repeat quotes
settings.description: Press tab or esc to quickly restart the test, or to quickly jump to the test page. Both options disable tab navigation on most parts of the website. Using the "esc" option will move opening the commandline to thetabkey.

settings.title: blind mode
settings.description: No errors or incorrect words are highlighted. Helps you to focus on raw speed. If enabled, quick end is recommended.

settings.title: always show words history
settings.description: This option will automatically show the words history at the end of the test. Can cause slight lag with a lot of words.

settings.title: single list command line
settings.description: When enabled, it will show the command line with all commands in a single list instead of submenu arrangements. Selecting 'manual' will expose all commands only after typing>.
When enabled, the website will use the British spelling instead of American. Note that this might not replace all words correctly. If you find any issues, please let us know.

settings.title: freedom mode
settings.description: Allows you to delete any word, even if it was typed correctly.

settings.title: strict space
settings.description: Pressing space at the beginning of a word will insert a space character when this mode is enabled.

settings.title: opposite shift mode
settings.description: This mode will force you to use oppositeshiftkeys for shifting. Using an incorrect one will count as an error. This feature ignores keys in locationsB,Y, and^because many people use the other hand for those keys. If you're using external software to emulate your layout (including QMK), you should use the "keymap" mode - the standard "on" will not work. This will enforce opposite shift based on the "keymap layout" setting.

settings.title: stop on error
settings.description: Letter mode will stop input when pressing any incorrect letters. Word mode will not allow you to continue to the next word until you correct all mistakes.

settings.title: confidence mode
settings.description: When enabled, you will not be able to go back to previous words to fix mistakes. When turned up to the max, you won't be able to backspace at all.
